posts.author: InitiativeTracker
posts.content:
I've been thinking about Creative lately and wanted to get everyone's opinions.

Quick question about Creative that came up in our game last night.

I'd love to hear everyone's experiences with Creative and how it's worked in your games.

What do you all think? Has anyone else had similar questions about Creative?

posts.author: BardTales
posts.content:
How do other DMs balance encounters that involve uses? I find it either makes combats too easy or too difficult.

I've been playing a Halfling Warlock in my campaign, and I've noticed that uses really impacts how effective the character is in combat.

I think the RAW (Rules As Written) for uses are clear, but many DMs seem to interpret it differently.

posts.author: MonkeyBusinessDM
posts.content:
The best campaign moment I ever had involved creative use of uses to solve what seemed like an impossible puzzle.

For my next character, I want to focus on uses as a central feature. What subclasses or multiclass options would work best with this?

In our last session, we encountered a Gelatinous Cube and tried to use uses to gain an advantage, but it didn't work out as planned.

posts.author: BarbarianBob
posts.content:
In the new 2024 rules update, they changed how Creative works. Now it's more streamlined but I'm not sure if it's better overall.

Looking at page 127 of the Player's Handbook, it states that Creative functions based on your proficiency bonus and ability modifiers.

The way I understand the rules for Creative, it should work like this: when you take the action, you need to roll ability checks to determine the outcome.
